page.title: 09Industrial development
page.content: The Pentwyn Industrial Estate was opened in 1974.There are 13 factories units but two are closed.Seven are manufacturing and 3 are service units. The products made are TV,Hi-Fi tuners, fizzy soft drinks,office equipment, pressed metal parts,self adhesive labels,scientific instruments and shutter doors for commercial vehicles. Products are sent around Britain, Europe and as far as Japan.The largest employer is Panasonic,610 workers,30% local.The smallest employer is BPSA Labels,18 workers,none local.The Avenue Industrial Estate is being built on farmland to the north.Boots warehouse is in operation;Marks and Spencers warehouse is being built and a further warehouse is planned.This project is partly financed by the European Regional Development Fund.
